articles.title: AI should help fund creative labour
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Generative AI models are built on the collective work of countless people. Writers, singers, journalists, poets, coders, illustrators, photographers, and filmmakers are behind every AI-generated response. Their creations have been used without permission or compensation. These creators have never received any compensation.

articles.title: Kozak: AI can improve teaching, and here's how
articles.author: Michael G. Kozak
articles.summary: Michael G. Kozak is an associate clinical professor at Drexel University. He teaches future educators about the potential of artificial intelligence to transform teaching and learning practices in K-12 schools. He encourages his students to use AI to shift from memorization and rote learning to emphasize critical thinking and creativity.

articles.title: Southern Arizona's small businesses unlock AI's potential
articles.author: Stephanie Healy
articles.summary: Cox Business's Small Business Survey found that more small businesses are deploying AI in everyday business operations. Small business owners are using AI to increase profitability, enhance productivity and improve customer experience. 85% of small business owners and 72% of employees are comfortable using AI tools in the workplace, but 76% don't plan to offer an AI training course for employees.
